trans-unit.source: Represents a row of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> that can contain controls.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref> class, specifying the containing <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
The containing <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
Gets the size and location of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>, including its nonclient elements, in pixels, relative to the parent control.

While the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.DisplayRectangle%2A> property gets only the client elements of the control, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.Bounds%2A> property gets the nonclient and client elements.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> representing the size and location.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> can be dragged and dropped into a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> to be dragged and dropped into the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>.
`true` if there is enough space in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref> to receive the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the controls in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>.
An array of controls.
Gets the space, in pixels, that is specified by default between controls.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> that represents the default space between controls.
Gets the internal spacing, in pixels, of the contents of a control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> that represents the internal spacing of the contents of a control.
Gets the display area of the control.

While the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.Bounds%2A> property gets the nonclient and client elements, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.DisplayRectangle%2A> property gets only the client elements of the control.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> representing the size and location.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets an instance of the control's layout engine.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.LayoutEngine"></xref> for the control's contents.
Gets or sets the space between controls.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> representing the space between controls.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.Bounds"></xref> property changes.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.OnBoundsChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The original value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.Bounds"></xref> property.
The new value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.Bounds"></xref> property.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlAdded"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.OnControlAdded%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The control that was added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>.
The zero-based index representing the position of the added control.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlRemoved"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.OnControlRemoved%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
The control that was removed from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>.
The zero-based index representing the position of the removed control.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Layout"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.OnLayout%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.Orientation"></xref> property changes.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow.OnOrientationChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Gets the layout direction of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref> relative to its containing <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Orientation"></xref> values.
Gets or sets padding within the control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> representing the control's internal spacing characteristics.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanel"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripPanelRow"></xref>.
